intro: Cacalia oligophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cacalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slight hairy texture. Cacalia oligophylla produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months.
